subject: Re: Fw: New message from customer support at Total Contacts
preview: Hi Elise,  I hope you are doing well.  Upon investigation, it appears that when the customer clicks the Reorder button, the box-related metadata isn't being applied correctly to the cart. Resolving th

full_threads.body:
Hi Elise,

I hope you are doing well.

Upon investigation, it appears that when the customer clicks the Reorder button, the box-related metadata isn't being applied correctly to the cart. Resolving this would likely require a deeper dive into the underlying code logic to trace how the metadata is handled—which may not be a quick fix.

In the meantime, I recommend manually entering the product along with the patient’s prescription details when processing these orders. This ensures both boxes (for each eye) are correctly added without relying on the automated reorder functionality.

Let me know if you'd like me to assist with that process or if you'd prefer to escalate the technical side for further review.

Hi Joel,

I'm just wanting to confirm that the issue of this customer not being able to purchase 2 boxes of product has been resolved?

Her original issue was that from the re-order function (for an order where a box for each eye was ordered) she wasn't being allowed to repurchase the box for each eye, the site/cart was only letting her purchase the one box in total.

We are still getting re-orders come through from Total Eyecare patients where we order the product for them, that's fine.

Kind regards,

Elise


​http://www.totalcontacts.com.au/

https://www.facebook.com/totalcontacts

Hi Elise,

Thanks for sending through the email and order number.

Upon checking, the field "I am a patient of Total Eyecare optometrists, you have my prescription" has been removed.

Here’s a quick WooCommerce workaround that may help you or your client if they're having trouble entering their details:
  1. Add the desired product(s) along with their prescription details to the cart and proceed to checkout.
  2. At the payment step, select “Credit Card” as the payment method and continue.
  3. In the WooCommerce backend, locate the order and manually assign it to the correct customer account.
  4. When the customer logs in, they’ll see the order under their account and can simply proceed to complete the payment.

I've also recorded a short Loom video to walk you through the steps: loom

Let me know if you need any further assistance!

Hi Joel,

Her email is: renata@therapytasmania.com.au

Elise

Hi Elise,

I hope you are doing well.

We are looking into this, do you know what the product she's trying to order?

Good morning!

I have this customer, who is trying to place a re-order, and she is not able to get a box for each eye into her cart - it will only allow 1 box in her cart.
She has also tried to increase quantities in the cart from 1 to 2 and is not able.
I also spoke with her on the phone for clarification.

She is a Total Eyecare patient, and previously used the "I am a TECO px" option (which we have completely disabled), which is also how her re-order would appear to us, in the sense that her re-order does not include any script information outside of what product she wears.

Would you know why this might be happening?

Kind regards,


Elise
